docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
I’m a Unity Game Developer and AR/VR Engineer with 6+ years of professional experience developing games, immersive AR/VR experiences, and interactive applications across mobile, WebGL, and standalone VR platforms.

My work spans the full development lifecycle, from prototyping and gameplay systems to shipping production-ready applications. Along the way, I’ve taken on increasing responsibility in technical leadership, system architecture, and team coordination.

docs.title: Procedural Generation
docs.text:
The gallery will be procedurally generated based on the categories you choose to display.

Why opt for procedural generation? To begin with, procedural generation adds a unique and engaging element, ensuring that every visit to the gallery offers a distinct experience.

Furthermore, it offers exceptional scalability. When the need arises to include a new project in the gallery, the generation scripts will seamlessly handle the task, expediting the process of adding new rooms.

docs.title: Script Dependency Viewer
docs.text: Unity C# Editor Tool

docs.title: Info
docs.text:
Script Viewer is a Unity Editor tool that provides a visual, interactive map of all C# scripts within your project’s Assets folder. Designed for developers who want better visibility and control over their codebase, it offers a drag-and-zoom workspace where each script is represented as a movable, clickable node (box) displaying the script's name and namespace.

With support for live editing, coloring, and navigation, Script Viewer improves project maintainability and understanding—especially in large or modular Unity projects.

docs.title: Drone Strike
docs.text: Unity C# VR Android Game

docs.title: Role
docs.text: Unity Developer

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Immerse yourself in the immersive and adrenaline-pumping universe of DroneStrike VR, where you assume the pivotal role of a formidable defender tasked with safeguarding your base. Confront ceaseless hordes of enemy drones in a gripping and futuristic battle for survival. Your strategic prowess will be put to the test as you meticulously select from a wide-ranging arsenal, including precision-guided missiles and fearless kamikaze drones, all in the tireless pursuit of preserving your main tower from the brink of destruction.

Will you rise to the occasion and emerge as the triumphant victor in this epic virtual reality face-off? DroneStrike VR invites you to engage, strategize, and assert your dominance in the boundless skies of this extraordinary gaming experience.

In DroneStrike VR, players are entrusted with the mission of safeguarding their base against an onslaught of menacing enemy drones and a formidable array of weaponry aimed at undermining both player and opponent. Within the gaming environment, numerous vital assets await, each possessing distinct objectives. For example, an oil factory generates essential credits that fuel the acquisition of additional assets, while a radar system heightens the efficiency of drone detection. Air defense mechanisms act as a shield against incoming aerial threats, and an assortment of handheld weapons further bolsters the player's arsenal.

Notably, players must adopt a shrewd and tactical approach to vanquish their adversary. Strategic targets encompass the radar, oil factory, and air defense systems, and victory hinges upon dismantling these critical components. Triumph in battle propels players to subsequent levels, permitting them to carry forward the hard-earned credits accumulated through oil production. Astute management of these credits is imperative, as each ensuing level intensifies in complexity and introduces an array of new weaponry and challenges.

As you progress through the game, your prowess will be measured by the leaderboards, where points are calculated based on the remaining oil reserves and the extent of damage sustained by your base.

The project didn't reach the end of production

docs.title: Challenges
docs.text: This was my first time working on a project of this scale, and I was the sole developer responsible for its development. One of the main challenges I faced was optimization—due to the large number of moving elements and multiple behaviors running simultaneously, performance issues quickly accumulated.

docs.title: Solutions
docs.text: Gained hands-on experience using profiling tools to identify, analyze, and resolve complex behavioral and performance issues, including CPU bottlenecks, memory usage spikes, and inefficient update loops, resulting in improved stability and overall application performance.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This compact project was created for a sustainable energy company within a tight three-day deadline. The objective was to craft an adventure for Goldy the gorilla. The result was an endless runner, drawing inspiration from games like Subway Surfers. Players control Goldy as they navigate side-to-side, jump, and roll to avoid obstacles, represented by a rolling tree trunk. The game features basic mechanics and employs randomly generated obstacles for a dynamic experience.

docs.title: Challenges
docs.text: The main difficulties revolved around a tight deadline and the need to develop a procedurally generated system that could present obstacles for the player to dodge.

docs.title: Solutions
docs.text:
In my first year of professional work, facing a tight deadline for the first time prompted me to meticulously organize the tasks I had so I would be able to complete the development of the game.

The incorporation of random obstacles posed both an entertaining and challenging aspect of the project. Since the character would be running around a spherical scenario, precise placement of obstacles with suitable distance and rotation was crucial to seamlessly integrate them into the scene without clipping with each other. Moreover, the obstacles would also need to disappear after the player dodges them to have room for new ones to spawn. This leads me to know more about object pooling and the benefits it was on optimization.

docs.title: Grandola Mupi
docs.text: Unity C# Game Android iOS

docs.title: Role
docs.text: Unity Developer

docs.title: Client
docs.text: Grândola's Municipal Chamber.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This project was designed for an interactive Mupi, featuring small, engaging, and educational games centered around Melides pottery. The primary aim was to offer a compact yet enjoyable experience, providing users with both entertainment and insights into the world of Melides pottery.

docs.title: Challenges
docs.text: The trickiest aspect of this project was putting together the Word Search game, especially since it was my first attempt at creating one.

docs.title: Solutions
docs.text:
To develop the Word Search game, I devised a system for placing words on a grid, allowing certain letter squares to serve multiple words. First, I randomly determined the direction of the word—horizontal or vertical. Once the direction was set, I selected a starting position by calculating a range within the grid size, considering the word's letter count. Moving through the squares, I checked if each square was either empty or contained the same letter as the one being placed.

If placing the word wasn't feasible, I sought a new position. In cases of repeated unsuccessful attempts, I reset the temporary grid board and restarted the generation process. To minimize the need for restarts, I ensured the grid was slightly larger than the largest word, this made the need for restarts very rare. After placing all the words, I filled the remaining empty squares with random letters and then displayed the grid on the screen.
